frontmatter.title: CivicActions at the 2016 FedScoop IT Summit
frontmatter.link_text: How the Federal Government Is Using IT to Lower Costs

node.html: CivicActions’ Director of Professional Services Elizabeth Raley moderated the agile discussion panel at FedScoop’s 8th annual Lowering the Cost of Government with IT Summit.

frontmatter.title: CivicActions Participates in the 2016 California Technology Forum
frontmatter.link_text: Speakers at the 2016 California Technology Forum

node.html: CivicActions’ Elizabeth Raley represents Agile Government Leadership at the 2016 California Technology Forum in a discussion about California’s pivotal move toward adopting agile practices in government IT.

frontmatter.title: Sharing Openly With Competitors To Help Government Work Better
frontmatter.link_text: Firm Aims to Work With Competitors in Chase for California Web Portal Contract

node.html: CivicActions takes a collaborative approach to improving services for at-risk children in California by sharing code with other firms who are competing for a contract with the state.

frontmatter.title: Supporting the Launch of AGL Academy
frontmatter.link_text: Free Online Initiative Trains Feds in Agile

node.html: Both StateScoop and FCW highlight CivicActions’ support of AGL Academy, a new initiative by Agile Government Leadership that helps government project managers gain skills in agile development practices through free online courses.

frontmatter.title: CivicActions in Federal Times: ‘Say goodbye to 100-page RFPs’
frontmatter.link_text: Say Goodbye to 100-page RFPs – 18F Found Another Way

node.html: CivicActions’ Vice President of Government Sales Bill Ogilvie explains how 18F’s agile procurement process will help firms solve government problems more effectively.
